required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Accuracy of a Specialized Pro Forma in Assessing Morbidly Adherent Placenta With Correlation to Intra-operative Findings
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Accuracy of a Specialized Pro Forma in Assessing Morbidly Adherent Placenta With Correlation to Intra-operative Findings

brief_summary.textblock: This study objective is to assess the accuracy of a specialized pro forma in suggesting the probability of Morbidly Adherent Placenta, its extent and its correlation with intraoperative findings.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical significance of ultrasound signs in MAP (most sensitive US sign)
Accuracy of our specialized pro forma in assessing extent of MAP (focal , diffuse)
Accuracy of our specialized pro forma in assessing depth of invasion of PAS (accrete, increta and percreta)

secondary_outcome.measure: 1- Correlation between US signs and intraoperative findings including morbidity and mortality

intervention.description: Ultrasound evaluation, with grayscale and color Doppler imaging.

study_pop.textblock: 21 pregnant females during their late 3rd trimester between (34 0/7: 37 0/7 weeks gestation)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age group 28:42 years.
- Pregnant women in their late third trimester (34 0/7 weeks: 37 0/7 weeks).
- With a single living fetus in the current pregnancy.
- A previous delivery by at least 1 cesarean section or history of uterine surgery including (surgical evacuation, myomectomy or endomertrial ablation)
- Having an anterior placenta previa or anterior low-lying placenta by ultrasound assessment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases with a non-previa placenta, posterior low lying placenta or posterior previa placenta.
- Maternal chronic medical disorders( DM, HTN)
- Patients presented with severe attack of bleeding.
- Patients presented with rupture of membrane.
- Emergency delivery regardless the cause.

facility.name: Cairo university Kasr Alainy OBGYN hospital
